summary: The Murder of Lord Robert Baratheon
title: The Murder of Lord Robert Baratheon
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2WUBuTi

by notanescalator

On a mild weekend in October of ‘32, Cersei Baratheon is playing glamorous/resentful hostess to a combustive mixture of English nobility, Hollywood stars of dubious sexuality, and one enigmatic businesswoman. The household was prepared for dropped glasses, awkward conversations and family shouting matches. A dead host? Not so much.

And who’s to tell which of the partygoers’ many secrets are tied to murder?

Words: 5054, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: Multi
  • Characters: Jaime Lannister, Cersei Lannister, Tyrion Lannister, Sansa Stark, Arya Stark, Brienne of Tarth, Jon Snow, Ygritte, Bran Stark, Margaery Tyrell, Loras Tyrell, Renly Baratheon, Daenerys Targaryen, Shae, Catelyn Tully Stark, Robert Baratheon
  • Relationships: Jaime Lannister/Brienne of Tarth, Jon Snow/Ygritte, Sansa Stark/Margaery Tyrell, Renly Baratheon/Loras Tyrell, Tyrion Lannister/Shae, Arya Stark/Gendry Waters
  • Additional Tags: 1930s Murder Mystery AU, this is what happens when you watch Agatha Christie and Gosford Park too close together, dramatic siblings, glamorous homosexuals, fictitious Germanic countries with unimaginitive names, one (1) canonical character death, as much as any of this is canon


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2WUBuTi

blog.title: abhorsen

title: Game of Thrones finale
body:
Things I liked:

  • Jon wandering off with Ghost and becoming a wildling. I hated how they got him there, but that being his ending worked for me.
  • Sansa becoming Queen in the North. It fit with her character arc and the way they’ve depicted her interactions with Northerners.
  • Ghost is a good boy and finally got a hug and the ending he wanted.
  • Arya leaving. By the time she finally managed to get back home to her family, she’d changed to much for it to feel like home. That sucks, but it fit for me.
  • The technical aspects of the episode were amazing, as was the acting. Everyone did the best they could with what they were given - they were just given terrible writing with a terrible plot.

Some unintentional humor/irony that made me laugh:

  • Jon dismissing the idea that people care about their house mottos when Mr. Fur-Cloaks-Are-Springtime-Clothing is the fucking personification of “winter is coming.”
  • Bran’s sister taking his house and seceding from the country after everyone agreed to make him king.

Things I hated:

  • Everything else.

reblog.comment:

  • Ghost is a good boy and finally got a hug and the ending he wanted.
  • Arya leaving. By the time she finally managed to get back home to her family, she’d changed to much for it to feel like home. That sucks, but it fit for me.
  • The technical aspects of the episode were amazing, as was the acting. Everyone did the best they could with what they were given - they were just given terrible writing with a terrible plot.

Some unintentional humor/irony that made me laugh:

  • Bran’s sister taking his house and seceding from the country after everyone agreed to make him king.

Things I hated:

  • Everything else.

  • The technical aspects of the episode were amazing, as was the acting. Everyone did the best they could with what they were given - they were just given terrible writing with a terrible plot.

summary: Okay seriously, after all the bullshit we went through for the last episode, what I really wanted was for the new Prince of...
question: Okay seriously, after all the bullshit we went through for the last episode, what I really wanted was for the new Prince of Dorne to walk up to Sansa right after she declared that the North should remain independent and tell her that he admires her intelligence, courage and beauty and kiss her on the hand. Then have Sansa blush a little at that as he walks away. If that happened I would ship them hard. Damn it Sansa just needs some love from SOMEONE who would give her the time of day.
answer:
Um…YES!

I’m sorry but both The North and Dorne seeking their independence and Sansa securing a southern alliance with the prince of Dorne would have been ten times better than what we got. Don’t get me wrong, I’m happy that my baby is the queen she always was but she deserves love! Real love! Someone to show her that gentle men exist and love can be tender and genuine and true! I will NOT accept Sansa’s arc ending with her completely alone when all she wants is family, children, and a marriage like her parents. If it couldn’t be Jon, then shit like it be that hottie from Dorne

Let him bring a shit ton of lemons from Dorne to court Sansa because she deserves it!
